item.title: Udev Device Mapping for Daily Tasks
item.description: UDEV is a userspace system that allows you to identify devices based on their properties, and register userspace handlers. Set persistent name for device. The task is to make persistent drive name. To do this, you need to create a new UDEV rule. It is better to create your own separate config for custom rules: [root@amigo rules.d]# cd /etc/udev/rules.d [root@amigo rules.d]# touch 30-local.rules The rule itself may look like this:
